definition: to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Don't spout off at the mouth about how the story is dumb.
sentences.chinese: 不要信口开河地评论他的需求是多么的愚蠢。

sentences.english: The old sailor love to spin yarn about his life at sea.
sentences.chinese: 那老水手爱信口开河地讲他的航海生涯。

sentences.english: You lay there on the bed, leaking, and I comforted you.
sentences.chinese: 你躺在床上，信口开河，我安慰你。

sentences.english: He spoke offhandedly, making it clear I had no say in the matter.
sentences.chinese: 他信口开河，明显表示这件事我无权发言。

sentences.english: Fritz is loud mouth who can not be trusted with secrets.
sentences.chinese: 费瑞兹是一个信口开河的人，不能把机密告诉他。

sentences.english: She never thinks before she speaks. She just shoots from the hip.
sentences.chinese: 她说话总是不经大脑就信口开河。

sentences.english: He always shoots his mouth off and says things he later regrets.
sentences.chinese: 他总是信口开河，结果尽说些让自己事后后悔的话。

sentences.english: She had a bad habit of spouting off.
sentences.chinese: 她有个信口开河的坏毛病。

sentences.english: Bones: I hate it when you make paranoia plausible.
sentences.chinese: 你这人偏执起来信口开河的时候还真讨厌。

sentences.english: Loose lips really can cause trouble.
sentences.chinese: 信口开河可真能带来麻烦。
他信口开河地作完了他的演说。

sentences.english: He has a tendency to pop off, unwittingly offending many people.
sentences.chinese: 他有信口开河的毛病，无意中得罪了不少人。

sentences.english: Sorry, I shouldn't have shot from the hip.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我不该信口开河的。

definition: to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
to talk rubbish
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
to boast/to talk big
to blow one's own trumpet (idiom)
to chatter/nonsense/blather
to make empty promises
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to talk big/to shoot off one's mouth/to chat (dialect)
fabrication relying on nothing (idiom); frame-up
a bunch of nonsense
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
